item.title: Dutch centrist Rob Jetten 'confident' as Geert Wilders' far-right party suffers setback in election
item.description: Geert Wilders' Freedom Party lost ground in elections which had been seen as a potential test of the far-right's staying power in European politics.

item.title: Dictionary.com's surprising choice for word of the year — 'six-seven'
item.description: Unveiling its choice for word of the year, Dictionary.com explained that it was not quite sure what six-seven meant.

item.title: US politicians call for Trump to act on 'unspeakable atrocities' in Sudan
item.description: The UN and others are condemning paramilitary Rapid Support Forces, which reportedly attacked civilians as it moved to seize new territory in the North African country.

item.title: Questions from ratepayers group over $20m redevelopment to historic Albert Hall in Launceston
item.description: A ratepayers' group is calling for an audit of the $20 million redevelopment of Launceston's heritage-listed Albert Hall for what it says are design flaws.

item.title: Leaked emails show NBN Co fast-tracked upgrade for Sky News host Andrew Bolt
item.description: Senior managers at the National Broadband Network intervened to accelerate a home internet upgrade for News Corp pundit Andrew Bolt and resolve a technical problem for a top executive's friend during the final stages of the infrastructure project's rollout.

item.title: Bulk-billing changes are coming into effect — what does it mean for you?
item.description: The government is pouring billions into Medicare so you have a better chance of being bulk-billed but the decision to charge or not charge still rests completely with your doctor.

item.title: Dangerous anti-renewables rhetoric, bullying and intimidation creates growing chasm in rural communities
item.description: There are grave concerns that dangerous language and bullying of farmers who are hosting renewable energy projects on their properties could turn into violence.

item.title: No plans to change Tim Tam recipe after rival UK biscuit can no longer be called chocolate
item.description: Food manufacturers are responding to high cocoa prices, and a change to the UK's Penguin biscuit may have all but cemented Australia's Tim Tam as the better of the two.

item.title: Girl, 5, dies after being hit by car outside school in north-west Sydney
item.description: A girl has died after being struck by a car outside a school in Sydney's north-west on Thursday afternoon.

item.title: Family of Frank Coleman say death in custody findings show prison system failures
item.description: Just three months into 2021, Frank Coleman was the ninth Indigenous death in custody in New South Wales.

item.title: Weekly news quiz: History exams, an unusual gift and the 'storm of the century'
item.description: It is time to see if you have been paying attention — test your memory of this week's news cycle here.

item.title: Australian-first treaty legislation passes in Victorian parliament
item.description: Historic legislation has passed that will see the creation of an Indigenous council that will be consulted on laws and policies affecting Indigenous communities.

item.title: Donald Trump sets US refugee cap at 7,500, white South Africans given priority
item.description: The US president paused all refugee admissions when he took office in January, saying they could only be restarted if established to be in the best interest of the nation.

item.title: Prince Andrew stripped of title by King Charles and told to leave Royal Lodge
item.description: Prince Andrew will have his royal titles removed and surrender the lease of the Royal Lodge on the grounds of Windsor.

item.title: Award-winning youth advocate Cody Schaeffer charged over alleged assaults on teenagers
item.description: The radio host and youth mental health charity founder has been charged with assaulting several teenagers, according to Queensland authorities.

item.title: Canberra is a step closer to getting its first dementia care village
item.description: Specialised accommodation will be built in Curtin to house those living with the nation's deadliest disease.

item.title: New-found love of running takes SA man all the way to New York Marathon
item.description: Six months ago, Jack Atkinson had little running experience. But this weekend he will tackle the world's largest marathon alongside NRL great Johnathan Thurston and AFL giant Lance 'Buddy' Franklin.

item.title: Heartbroken dad wants Senate inquiry into doctor suicides
item.description: There are calls for a Senate inquiry into the suicide deaths of Australian doctors amid allegations of untenable rosters and payback for whistleblowers.

item.description: Australia captain Alyssa Healy says her side only have themselves to blame as the defence of their World Cup crown comes to an end.

item.title: Emma Stone reunites with director Yorgos Lanthimos for fourth time in Bugonia
item.description: Yorgos Lanthimos continues his journey as the king of absurdist dark comedies with this latest offering, which delves into conspiracy theories in the most bizarre way.

item.title: Women paid thousands less per year than men in Victoria's forest firefighting ranks
item.description: The Australian Workers' Union says Victorian female forest firefighters have been short-changed by an average of more than $4,000 in pay growth since 2019.

item.description: As Breast Cancer Awareness Month draws to a close, support groups urge Chinese women to get screened for breast cancer, as doctors highlight how the disease impacts this cohort differently.

item.title: Olympic Leisure Centre swimmers left high and dry as historic aquatic venue closes

item.title: Strong filial responsibilities can make discussing aged care a sensitive topic among multicultural families.

item.title: Talking about aged care in multicultural families can be hard but these tips may help
item.description: Discussing aged care in culturally diverse families can be a sensitive subject. Here's how some approached the conversation.

item.title: Horse racing replays edited to remove falls and deaths as industry grapples with social licence
item.description: For years, the racing industry has been quietly removing falls and deaths from its replays. Now, industry insiders are speaking out.

item.title: I tried to outsmart the social media algorithm. Here's how it outsmarted me
item.description: Armed with a burner phone and a fake name, I set out to learn how Instagram’s algorithm really works. This is what happened next.

item.title: Tasmanian couple buys the Eulo Queen Hotel in outback Queensland
item.description: Adam and Prue Brancher had no experience running a pub when they decided to uproot their lives in Tasmania and move to outback Queensland.

item.title: A game for the ages: Nan and teen granddaughter line up together in country netball
item.description: A grandmother and granddaughter played for their regional Victorian netball team, turning a secret plan into a moment of country sport history.

item.title: Copper theft costing Queensland taxpayers millions of dollars every year, as rate of crime increases
item.description: Experts say cost of living pressures, and the ability to make money quickly, is behind a surge in copper thefts which are leaving highways and sporting fields in the dark.

item.title: Do the Queensland government’s claims about the surgical waiting list stack up?
item.description: Queensland's government declared victory on elective surgery wait times but thousands of patients are waiting longer than recommended — and specialists warn the fix is short-term at best.

item.title: From death masks to selfies: The history of our love-affair with portraits
item.description: Whether it's an ancient death mask found on an Egyptian sarcophagus or the selfie you have just cropped on your phone, we have been creating portraits for centuries. So why do we love them so much?

item.title: How taxidermists are 'honouring the life' of extraordinary creatures through art and science
item.description: From a taxidermied mynah bird perched on a teacup to a mammoth leatherback turtle, here are the "extraordinary creatures" these taxidermists are preserving.

item.title: House prices have been climbing for a generation. Undoing the damage could take even longer
item.description: It's an inconvenient truth that a housing crisis that took a generation to create cannot be fixed easily. The damage will likely take another generation to undo, unless the solution comes at the expense of those who already own their homes.

item.title: Australian number one Maya Joint loses in Hong Kong Open semis, Kim Birrell through to Chennai final
item.description: Australian number one Maya Joint falls short of reaching the Hong Kong Open final, but compatriot Kimberly Birrell wins through to the tournament decider in Chennai.

item.title: Israel says three bodies returned from Gaza are not those of hostages held by Hamas
item.description: Hamas says it offered to hand over samples of the unidentified bodies, but Israel refused and asked for the remains for examination.

item.title: Think you've got what it takes to top this quiz? It's time to play ... HARD!
item.description: Let's get it straight: you'll probably do badly on this quiz, and I'll judge you. It's time to play … HARD!

item.title: Pitch invader stands with Kangaroos during national anthems before Ashes Test against England
item.description: A man is arrested by police after he lined up next to Cameron Munster before the Kangaroos' victory over England in the second Ashes Test in England.

item.title: Rock climbers' defiance grows over Mount Arapiles cultural site requests
item.description: Rock climbers are publicly urging others to ignore Parks Victoria's requests to avoid culturally significant routes at Mount Arapiles Dyurrite in western Victoria.

item.title: Kirsha Kaechele banned men from MONA's Ladies Lounge — and won
item.description: No men are allowed at Kirsha Kaechele's Ladies Lounge and the Supreme Court agrees. The artist, curator and "missus" of MONA's owner knows how to cross boundaries, but can she solve Tasmania's thorniest dispute?

item.title: South-east Queensland struck by second night of storms as residents assess hail damage
item.description: Queensland residents still counting the cost of giant hailstones that fell on Saturday afternoon were struck by a second round of storms on Sunday, with hailstones up to eight centimetres in diameter reported at Googa Creek.

item.title: Fishers and researchers are working together to create a 'transformational' data set
item.description: An international program in which researchers collaborate with the fishing industry is generating a dataset that will change global weather forecasting.

item.title: Sting linked to AN0M encrypted app which brought down criminals around the world enters new phase
item.description: An international covert sting linked to the encrypted AN0M platform which brought down hundreds of alleged criminals and netted cash, drugs and weapons has reached a new phase.

item.title: Donald Trump warns Nigerian government of US military action over alleged killings of Christians
item.description: Donald Trump is threatening to pull US aid and going "guns-a-blazing" as he accuses the Nigerian government of allowing the killing of Christians.

item.title: UK train stabbing leaves 10 in hospital, nine with life-threatening injuries, police say
item.description: British police declare a "major incident", with counter-terrorism officers investigating a mass stabbing attack on a London-bound train.

item.title: Women's crisis shelter waits years to sub-lease vacant NT building
item.description: An Aboriginal-led domestic violence support service is demanding answers over stalled progress in establishing a women's shelter in remote Northern Territory.

item.title: Jockey Ethan Brown makes rise from from near-fatal fall to Melbourne Cup
item.description: Two years after a near-fatal fall, 25-year-old Alice Springs-born jockey has had a bumper season with 32 wins. Now he is riding in the Melbourne Cup.

item.title: Calls for road map for disability employment providers after Bedford's troubles
item.description: Some in the disability employment sector say they are operating in an increasingly complex and changing environment, and that there is a need for a clear way forward for organisations supporting people with complex needs.

item.title: There was a large police presence after reports of stabbings on a train in Cambridgeshire.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Coalition won't back environment reforms without changes
item.description: The Coalition says it cannot support major reforms to Australia's environment laws in their current reform, setting a bar as they enter deep negotiations with the federal government.

item.title: Australian-first domestic violence digital notification service for victim-survivors to launch in NSW
item.description: DV Notify, a joint federal and NSW government led initiative, will provide real-time text and email updates from the time a violent offender is arrested through to their final sentencing.

item.title: Christmas Island shrew declared extinct after decades without a sighting
item.description: A researcher says the long-suspected extinction of the mouse-sized mammal is "another stain" on Australia's environmental record.

item.title: Did a former Perth bikie order the public assassination of his one-time gang leader?
item.description: With all the hallmarks of a Hollywood blockbuster, the high-profile murder trial of ex-bikie David Pye in WA's Supreme Court was never going to be a pedestrian affair.

item.title: Southern NSW summer crops shrink amid water shortages
item.description: Southern NSW rice and cotton growers are heading into one of their smallest summer cropping seasons in years, with tight water allocations forcing many to halve their plantings or sit the season out altogether.

item.title: Spotlight on youth justice after dozens arrested in WA's north
item.description: The political spotlight has once again turned to preventing and managing youth crime in Western Australia, but decision-makers are split on how best to tackle the issue.

item.title: What is the difference between an e-bike and an e-motorbike? What are the laws around them?
item.description: Noticing a lot of e-bikes around lately? Here's a state-by-state breakdown of the laws about them.

item.title: Veteran credits his local RSL with helping to pull him out of darkness
item.description: A veteran in Victoria says he found hope and solace in his local RSL that "had his back" when he felt overwhelmed by his wife's early onset dementia.

item.title: High demand for ambulances in Melbourne and Geelong as weather warms up on Cup weekend
item.description: Victorians are being urged to only call triple-0 for critical cases as demand for an ambulance soars on the quasi-Melbourne Cup long weekend.

item.title: Australian world champion Matthew Hauser wins Noosa Triathlon
item.description: Only a fortnight after being crowned men's world champion, Australia's Matthew Hauser tops the podium at the revered Noosa Triathlon.

item.title: Critically endangered shrub on NSW Northern Tablelands could have prosperous future
item.description: There are signs a critically endangered plant that grows on a rural property near Armidale could have a prosperous future.

item.title: The tensions inherent in Australia's housing crisis laid bare at Perth gallery
item.description: In an exhibition exploring the fraught issue of finding a home, artist Alana Hunt is directly inviting owners of multiple properties to solve her own, personal housing crisis.

item.title: Koalas found at Avonside in the NSW Snowy Mountains
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Drones spot hidden koala population in NSW Snowy Mountains
item.description: A hidden group of koalas is found for the first time in a remote area of the New South Wales Snowy Mountains.

item.title: Canadian PM Mark Carney apologises to Donald Trump over anti-tariff Reagan ad
item.description: Canadian PM Mark Carney says he apologised to an "offended" US President Donald Trump over the ad, which led to trade talks being suspended and an additional 10 per cent tariff.

item.title: Police ask for help after body found in burnt-out ute in NSW Riverina
item.description: Two people have been killed in fatal crashes across the Riverina just hours apart.

item.title: Nationals formally abandon commitment to reach net zero emissions by 2050
item.description: The Nationals have formally abandoned a commitment to reach net zero emissions by 2050, setting a challenge for Opposition leader Sussan Ley whether to follow or risk splitting the Coalition.

item.title: Female jockey Jamie Melham discusses riding Melbourne Cup favourite Half Yours
item.description: Jockey Jamie Melham says she will be doing a "rain dance" on Monday, ahead of riding Melbourne Cup favourite Half Yours.

item.title: Three generations tackle 12th annual Variety Postie Bike Dash at Nabiac
item.description: Brian leads three generations of his family in the annual Variety Postie Bike Dash, raising money for sick and disadvantaged kids.

item.title: Christopher James McLoughney refused bail over alleged murder of Rhukaya Lake
item.description: A man charged with the domestic violence murder of 39-year-old Hunter woman Rhukaya Lake is remanded in custody.

item.title: Police stop train at Huntingdon Station after mass stabbing
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Orla O'Dwyer of the Brisbane Lions celebrates a goal
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: AFLW round 12: Crows hold on to eliminate Dockers from finals contention, Lions finish third after beating Magpies
item.description: Adelaide has hung on for a thrilling 12-point win over Fremantle that secures its AFLW finals spot and ends the Dockers' season.

item.title: Car park closure leaves parts of Canberra's city centre inaccessible for people with disability
item.description: Patients with mobility issues are struggling to visit medical professionals after the Theatre Lane car park closed for the construction of the Lyric Theatre.

item.title: Easy low-alcohol cocktails and non-alcoholic drinks for summer
item.description: Having a range of drinks on offer can help everyone feel included, especially at end-of-year gatherings.

item.title: LA Dodgers win 2025 World Series game seven over Toronto Blue Jays
item.description: The Los Angeles Dodgers rallied to beat the Toronto Blue Jays 5-4 in extra innings of a decisive seventh game of the World Series to become Major League Baseball's first repeat champion in 25 years.

item.title: Eliesa Katoa fitted with oxygen mask during Tonga vs New Zealand Test match, Jillaroos defeat Kiwi Ferns
item.description: Tongan forward Eliesa Katoa has been fitted with an oxygen mask during the Pacific Championship Test match against New Zealand, after copping multiple blows to the head.

item.title: Man dies after worksite incident in South Kalgoorlie
item.description: A worker in his 60s has died after sustaining critical injuries on a property in South Kalgoorlie.

item.title: Inmate taken to hospital after alleged assault at SA's Yatala Labour Prison
item.description: A prisoner has been taken to the hospital after the second alleged violent assault in two weeks in the South Australian prison system.

item.title: Australia's scandal-ridden childcare sector is a legacy of the 'golden age' of reform
item.description: The decision by past governments to push Australia's childcare industry in the direction of marketisation and corporatisation has left a lasting legacy.

item.title: India levels T20 series against Australia with impressive run chase in Hobart
item.description: India levels the Twenty20 series against Australia, sharing the blows with the bat for a five wicket win with nine balls to spare in Hobart.

item.title: India vs South Africa, ICC Women's ODI Cricket World Cup final, live updates from Navi Mumbai
item.description: South Africa must score 299 runs to win the first Women's ODI World Cup final not to feature Australia or England. Follow live.

item.title: 'Nothing to suggest' stabbing attack on train was a terrorist incident, UK police say
item.description: Police investigating a mass stabbing on a train bound for London on Saturday say there is nothing to suggest it was a terrorist attack.

item.title: Wedding guests shelter under tables as storm tears roof from historic Camboon Campdraft Hall
item.description: Dozens of wedding guests rushed to shelter children under tables and hold up the walls of a reception hall during an intense storm in Queensland's Banana Shire over the weekend.

item.title: Investors and first home buyers flock to property market, driving up prices
item.description: Australia's property market is seeing rising demand, with record auctions over spring and a rise in both first home buyers and investors pushing up house prices.
